resources:
// Week 1
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_one_workout~Body Weight AMRAP Workout~ As Many Reps and Rounds As Possible In:
 Beginners – 8 Minutes

 1. Sit to stand to hop (single leg or double leg) (10x)
 2. Dips on bench (10x)
 3. Toe Touch Ab Crunch (10x)
 4. Jumping Jacks (10x)
 Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday
NA~Welcome To Your First Turn It Up Tuesday: Aerobic Day or Active Rest Day~Using smart training practices means respecting one’s rest periods. That means, for one’s “Fast Twitch” muscle fibers (the target with our main workouts), joints and nervous system to recover optimally, a rest day or two is needed. However, rest days don’t have to be lazy days. In fact, active rest targeting “Slow Twitch” muscle fibers (which aerobic activity does) is a great change-up for burning calories and promoting recovery. This on top of mobility and flexibility practices makes an ideal, in-between workout day.


Choose from the following:
 Running, biking, hiking, stairs, swimming, basketball, soccer, frisbee, another sport, rock climbing, jumping jacks, burpees, high knees, skiing, cross-country skiing, snow shoeing, hopscotch, bear crawls, playing with the kids or whatever keeps you moving for…
 Beginners: 10 minutes


Post Workout: Core and Stretch:
 Pick at least 6 stretches and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple of times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling. This is the perfect recovery enhancer and can be done anywhere (even if you do not own a foam roller (check out foam rolling on Dr. Oz earlier this year!)


If you typically get sore after workouts, stretching immediately after a workout will help alleviate some of this. As well, stretching POST-workout will help prevent injury, speed up muscle recovery and enhance overall fitness level. Go to the stretching section to get started on this recovery practice.


Feel free to ask questions below, or in the community area. We would love to hear your feedback, as well as see group interaction.
// Wednesday
NA~Mobility, Core and Stretch~Today is a light workout, focusing on your total core strength, range of motion and ending with foam rolling and stretching. This will help speed up recovery and loosen up sore, tight muscles.

 Core and Stretching:
 Pick at least 6 stretches from the Stretch Tab and hold for 20-30 seconds each.

 For Complete Fitness, Make Nutrition a Priority
 * Be sure to follow up every workout with a high (lean) protein snack and clean carb (fruit counts depending on which meal-plan you chose). As well, drink plenty of water throughout the day and after workouts.


* Follow your nutrition plan exactly and use the recipe board for substitutions for best results. Let us know how we can assist you through your fitness journey. Just remember, nutrition is close to 80% of the physical results, so don’t rely solely on exercise.
// Thursday
bodyweight_workout_week_one_workout~Welcome To Your First Throwback Thursday!~ Your Challenge Is To Beat Monday’s Score!


As Many Reps and Rounds As Possible In:
 Beginners – 8 Minutes

 1. Sit to stand to hop (single leg or double leg) (10x)
 2. Dips on bench (10x)
 3. Toe Touch Ab Crunch (10x)
 4. Jumping Jacks (10x)
 Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Friday

That means, for one’s “Fast Twitch” muscle fibers (the target with our main workouts), joints and nervous system to recover optimally, a rest day or two is needed.


However, rest days don’t have to be lazy days. In fact, active rest targeting “Slow Twitch” muscle fibers (which aerobic activity does) is a great change-up for burning calories and promoting recovery. This on top of mobility and flexibility practices makes an ideal, in-between workout day.

 Pick at least 6 stretches and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple of times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling. This is the perfect recovery enhancer and can be done anywhere (even if you do not own a foam roller (check out foam rolling on Dr. Oz earlier this year!)


If you typically get sore after workouts, stretching immediately after a workout will help alleviate some of this. As well, stretching POST-workout will help prevent injury, speed up muscle recovery and enhance overall fitness level. Go to the stretching section to get started on this recovery practice.


Feel free to ask questions below, or in the community area. We would love to hear your feedback, as well as see group interaction.

 Way to finish the week strong! Keep up the great work and stick to your meal plan! You rock!
// Week 2
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_two_workout~Round For Time Body Weight Workout~ Beginners: 2 Rounds


1. Squat with a Side Crunch (B: 5 reps)
 2. Plank with Side Toe Taps and Push -Up (B: 5 reps)
 3. Plate Pull Ins and Push Outs (B: 5 reps)
 4. Double Ab Crunch (B: 15 reps)
 5. Mt. Climbers (B: 15 reps)
 6. Pogo Hops (B: 15 reps)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday

// Week 3
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_three_workout~Body Weight Total Body Meltdown~ Beginners: 10 Minute AMRAP


1. Alternating Lunges or Squats (10x)
 2. Side to Side Push-Ups (10x)
 3. Hip Pulse (10x)
 4. Burpees (10x)
 5. Boxer Shuffle (10x)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

// Week 4
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_four_workout~Retest Week~ Re-test Baseline Workout:
 Baseline Test:


1. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 2. Squat or Chair Squats (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 3. Plank or Knee Plank (How long can you hold the plank?)



Monday’s Workout: The Fat Burning Body Weight Workout:


Beginners: 2-3 Rounds


1. Inch Worm Push-Ups (12x)
 2. Gate Swings (12x)
 3. Plank with Side Toe Taps (12x)
 4. Plate Pull Ins/Push-Outs (12x)
 5. Boxer Shuffle (50x)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday

// Week 5
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_five_workout~Total Body Toning AMRAP~ Full Body Toning AMRAP Workout:
 Beginners: 10 Minutes and 10 Reps


1. Push-Ups w/ Yoga Twist
 2. Plate Pull-Ins and Push-Outs
 3. Jump Squats
 4. Crab Dips w/ Leg Kick
 5. Plank (rock forward and back)
 6. Butt Kickers


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday

// Week 6
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_six_workout~The Filthy 20 Workout~ The Filthy 20 Workout (Chipper Workout):
 One round for time of 20 reps each exercise
 Beginners: 20 reps


1. Star Jacks or Jumping Jacks
 2. Lunge-Lunge-Hop or Squat and Hop
 3. Knee Tricep Push-Ups
 4. Towel Back Row (use a sturdy object) or sub in plate pull ins and push-outs
 5. Running High Knees or Marching High Knees


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday

// Week 7
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_seven_workout~The Superset Circuit~ The Superset Circuit Workout (Rounds For Time):


Beginners:1-2 Rounds
 Intermediate: 2-3 Rounds
 Advanced: 3-4 Rounds


Complete 12 reps of each exercise. Complete all sets of the couplet A and B before moving on. Rest 30-60 seconds in between each couplet.


1. Couplet: Squats 12x and Push-ups 12x (Complete all rounds before moving onto couplet #2)
 2. Couplet: Tuck Jumps 12x and Door Frame Back Rows 12x
 3. Couplet: Mt. Climbers 12x and Tricep Dips 12x
 4. Couplet: Hip Bridges 12x and Supermans 12x


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday
NA~Turn It Up Tuesday: Aerobic Day or Active Rest Day~Using smart training practices means respecting one’s rest periods. That means, for one’s “Fast Twitch” muscle fibers (the target with our main workouts), joints and nervous system to recover optimally, a rest day or two is needed. However, rest days don’t have to be lazy days. In fact, active rest targeting “Slow Twitch” muscle fibers (which aerobic activity does) is a great change-up for burning calories and promoting recovery. This on top of mobility and flexibility practices makes an ideal, in-between workout day.


Choose from the following:
 Running, biking, hiking, stairs, swimming, basketball, soccer, frisbee, another sport, rock climbing, jumping jacks, burpees, high knees, skiing, cross-country skiing, snow shoeing, hopscotch, bear crawls, playing with the kids or whatever keeps you moving for…
 Beginners: 22 minutes


Post Workout: Core and Stretch:
 Pick at least 6 stretches and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple of times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling. This is the perfect recovery enhancer and can be done anywhere (even if you do not own a foam roller (check out foam rolling on Dr. Oz earlier this year!)


If you typically get sore after workouts, stretching immediately after a workout will help alleviate some of this. As well, stretching POST-workout will help prevent injury, speed up muscle recovery and enhance overall fitness level. Go to the stretching section to get started on this recovery practice.


Feel free to ask questions below, or in the community area. We would love to hear your feedback, as well as see group interaction.
// Wednesday
NA~Mobility, Core and Stretch~Today is a light workout, focusing on your total core strength, range of motion and ending with foam rolling and stretching. This will help speed up recovery and loosen up sore, tight muscles.

 Core and Stretching:
 Pick at least 6 stretches from the Stretch Tab and hold for 20-30 seconds each.

 For Complete Fitness, Make Nutrition a Priority
 * Be sure to follow up every workout with a high (lean) protein snack and clean carb (fruit counts depending on which meal-plan you chose). As well, drink plenty of water throughout the day and after workouts.


* Follow your nutrition plan exactly and use the recipe board for substitutions for best results. Let us know how we can assist you through your fitness journey. Just remember, nutrition is close to 80% of the physical results, so don’t rely solely on exercise.
// Thursday
bodyweight_workout_week_seven_workout~Throwback Thursday!~ Your Challenge Is To Beat Monday’s Score!


The Superset Circuit Workout (Rounds For Time):


Beginners:1-2 Rounds
 Intermediate: 2-3 Rounds
 Advanced: 3-4 Rounds


Complete 12 reps of each exercise. Complete all sets of the couplet A and B before moving on. Rest 30-60 seconds in between each couplet.


1. Couplet: Squats 12x and Push-ups 12x (Complete all rounds before moving onto couplet #2)
 2. Couplet: Tuck Jumps 12x and Door Frame Back Rows 12x
 3. Couplet: Mt. Climbers 12x and Tricep Dips 12x
 4. Couplet: Hip Bridges 12x and Supermans 12x


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Friday

bodyweight_workout_week_three_workout~Retest Week #3 Workout~ Re-test Baseline Workout:
 Baseline Test:

 1. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 2. Squat or Chair Squats (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 3. Plank or Knee Plank (How long can you hold the plank?)



Total Body Meltdown AMRAP:
 Beginners: 10 Minute AMRAP


Alternating Lunges or Squats (10x)
 Side to Side Push-Ups (10x)
 Hip Pulse (10x)
 Burpees (10x)
 Boxer Shuffle (10x)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

bodyweight_workout_week_nine_workout~The Super Shred Rounds For Time Workout~ The Super Shred Workout (Rounds For Time):
 Beginners: 2 Rounds


1) Door Frame Rows (12x)
 2) Starburst Burpee (12x) or 45 second plank hold for beginners.
 3) Alternating Lunges (24x) or squats for beginners.
 4) Double Crunch (x12)
 5) Push Ups w/ Alternating Kick Backs (12x) or traditional push-ups for beginners.
 6) Burpees (12x)
 7) Running High Knees (24x) or Marching for beginners


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

bodyweight_workout_week_ten_workout~The Fat Torching Chipper~ The Fat Torching Chipper Workout:
 Beginners: 50 Reps
 Intermediate: 80 Reps
 Advanced: 100 Reps


1) Plank Jacks or Mt. Climbers (B)
 2) Side to side push-ups
 3) Sit-Ups or Crunches (B and I)
 4) Door Frame Rows (x50 each side)
 5) Gate Swings or Squats (B) (2 Count)
 Optional Badge Bonus: Burpees at the prescribed reps


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

// Week 11
// Monday
bodyweight_workout_week_eleven_workout~The Fat Blasting AMRAP Workout~ The Fat Blasting AMRAP Workout:
 Beginners: 12 Minute AMRAP
 Intermediate: 15 Minute AMRAP
 Advanced: 20 Minute AMRAP


1) Plyo Push-Ups (Advanced), Push-Ups (Intermediate and Beginners) (12x)
 2) Scissor Hops (Lunge Hops) (Advanced), Alternating Lunges (Intermediate) and Squats (Beginner) (12x each leg)
 3) Jump Squats or Squats (B) (12x)
 4) Plate Pull-Ins / Push Outs (12x)
 5) Tricep Dips on Chair/Stair or Bench (12x)
 6) Step Ups on Chair/Stair or Bench (12x on each leg)
 7) Single Leg Hip Bridge (Advanced), Hip Bridge (Beginner and Intermediate) (12x)
 8) Wall Sits (30 seconds)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday

bodyweight_workout_week_six_workout~Retest Week #6 Workout~ Re-test Baseline Workout:
 Baseline Test:


1. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 2. Squat or Chair Squats (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 3. Plank or Knee Plank (How long can you hold the plank?)



The Filthy 20 Workout (Chipper Workout):
 One round for time of 20 reps each exercise
 Beginners: 20 reps


1. Star Jacks or Jumping Jacks
 2. Lunge-Lunge-Hop or Squat and Hop
 3. Knee Tricep Push-Ups
 4. Towel Back Row (use a sturdy object) or sub in plate pull ins and push-outs
 5. Running High Knees or Marching High Knees


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

That means, for one’s “Fast Twitch” muscle fibers (the target with our main workouts), joints and nervous system to recover optimally, a rest day or two is needed.


However, rest days don’t have to be lazy days. In fact, active rest targeting “Slow Twitch” muscle fibers (which aerobic activity does) is a great change-up for burning calories and promoting recovery. This on top of mobility and flexibility practices makes an ideal, in-between workout day.


Choose from the following: Running, biking, hiking, stairs, swimming, basketball, soccer, frisbee, another sport, rock climbing, jumping jacks, burpees, high knees, skiing, cross-country skiing, snow shoeing, hopscotch, bear crawls, playing with the kids or whatever keeps you moving for…
 Beginners: 32 minutes

 Post Workout: Core and Stretch:
 Pick at least 6 stretches and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple of times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling. This is the perfect recovery enhancer and can be done anywhere (even if you do not own a foam roller (check out foam rolling on Dr. Oz earlier this year!)


If you typically get sore after workouts, stretching immediately after a workout will help alleviate some of this. As well, stretching POST-workout will help prevent injury, speed up muscle recovery and enhance overall fitness level. Go to the stretching section to get started on this recovery practice.


Feel free to ask questions below, or in the community area. We would love to hear your feedback, as well as see group interaction.

 Way to finish the week strong! Keep up the great work and stick to your meal plan! You rock!
